Avoid catheter unless one or more indicators met:  - Retention not relieved by 2 in and out catheters  - Critically ill-accurate output required  - Advanced pressure ulcer & incontinent  - End of life comfort  - Severe pain unrelieved with analgesics

If PVR greater than 350 mL, insert Foley catheter. Remove Foley catheter next day at 0600 or when epidural infusion D/C'ed. Once Foley removed, if unable to void, perform straight intermittent catheterization x 2 PRN

If not voided in 8 hours after Foley removal or post-op, check bladder volume. If bladder volume is greater than 350 mL, intermittent in/out catheterization PRN q8h x 24 hours. If not voiding after 24 hours, notify physician
